intro: Rothmannia whitfieldii, commonly known as the whitefield's rothmannia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display. Rothmannia whitfieldii is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter.
